direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods modify the state of the queue by removing elements, though clear removes all elements while remove removes one at a time.
Both methods involve state changes and handle the queue's internal array, though add inserts elements while clear removes them.
Both methods involve resetting the state of the queue, though readObject does so by deserializing data.
Both methods interact with the queue's state, though writeObject serializes the queue's state.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing the queue with a specific size can be used to set up the test environment for clear.
Adding elements to the queue can be used to set up a non-empty queue before calling clear.
Removing elements can be used to simulate a partially cleared queue before calling clear.
Checking if the queue is empty can be used to verify the result of clear.
Checking the size of the queue can be used to verify that clear has removed all elements.
